name: Dreams of Stardom Quiz | TV & Movies Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: "All About Eve" is remembered for Bette Davis' "comeback role" as Margo Channing, but the movie is also about a young would-be actress (Eve) who dreams of stardom. Who plays Eve?
questions.explanation:
Anne Baxter.

	With George Sanders and a young Marilyn Monroe (in a small part).

questions.text: "In a week, maybe two, they'll make you a star ..." Who sang the song?
questions.explanation:
Dionne Warwick.

	"Do You Know the Way to San Jose?" Bacharach and David. Good lyric.

questions.text: "Career" was an interesting film about a would-be actor who was devoted to his craft. Who played the lead?
questions.explanation:
Tony Franciosa.

	The under-appreciated Franciosa starred in this one. Always easygoing and easy to watch.

questions.text: Inevitably, there had to be a movie about "the Oscar". Who starred in the movie of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Stephen Boyd.

	Boyd is another under-appreciated actor. Best known for "Ben-Hur".

questions.text: "A Chorus Line" may be the ultimate dream-of-stardom vehicle: it focuses on several up-and-comers who have the dream. Who starred in the movie version?
"They're gonna put me in the movies; they're gonna make a big star out of me ..." what song has these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Act Naturally.

	Not really a song about wanting to be a star - but the lyric fits, anyway.

questions.text: What was the storyline of the legendary play, "42nd Street"?
questions.correct: Understudy gets her big chance to be a star
options: Wanna-be star will do anything to get what she wants
Starlet faces the harsh reality that she doesn't have the talent to make it big
Would-be star gives it all up for love and marriage
questions.explanation:
Understudy gets her big chance to be a star.

	One of the early "dream-of-stardom" pieces. By Gower Champion."Come and meet those dancing feet ..."

questions.text: The anthem of show business that keeps the dream alive is "There's No Business Like Show Business". Who is best known for singing this song?
questions.explanation:
Ethel Merman.

	"Next day on your dressing room they've hung a star  - let's go, on with the show."

questions.text: "Stage Door" was an early vehicle for which legendary actress?
questions.explanation:
Katharine Hepburn.

	Early starring role for Hepburn. Re-made later with the late Susan Strasberg in the role.

questions.text: Marlo Thomas starred in the TV series "That Girl" about a girl who wants to make it in show biz. Ted Bessell was the boyfriend; what was his line of work?
questions.explanation:
Magazine Writer.

	Don wrote for "Newsview" magazine. Cute stuff for the time.
